meanings.definition: Estimate or calculate (something) without sufficient information or data.
meanings.sent1: I guesstimated the number of jellybeans in the jar.
meanings.sent2: She guesstimated the time it would take to finish the project.
meanings.sent3: He guesstimated the weight of the elephant using a bathroom scale.
meanings.sent4: The detective guesstimated the suspect's height based on the door frame.
meanings.sent5: The teacher guesstimated the length of the rope by eyeing it carefully.

meanings.sent1: Her guesstimated cost for the repairs was way off.
meanings.sent2: The guesstimated attendance for the event was surprisingly high.
meanings.sent3: The guesstimated age of the ancient artifact made the archaeologists chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The guesstimated value of the antique vase was beyond imagination.
meanings.sent5: His guesstimated score on the test turned out to be remarkably accurate.
